revised_title: Catalytic Decomposition of Heterocyclic Compounds: Reaction Kinetics and Mechanism
tldr: This article investigates the catalytic decomposition of simple heterocyclic compounds, such as thiophen, furane, and pyrrole, on molybdenum disulphide and nickel sulphide catalysts. The authors found that the decomposition occurs through two-point adsorption, leading to a half-hydrogenated state from which the hetero-atom is broken off. The reaction kinetics and mechanisms are discussed, and the role of various catalysts and retardants is analyzed.
